issue.title: Simplify the process of using gazebo as a library even more

content.raw:
I think I'm starting to get lost.

You're creating your own `main()` that initializes and runs gazebo as a library. I assume it is similar in principle to
[examples/stand_alone/custom_main/custom_main.cc](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/d6bfa5238c7c0cb3963716df16475b97f1f0051b/examples/stand_alone/custom_main/custom_main.cc?at=default)?

However, you are parsing your own command-line parameters to that program. So you don't want to just pass argc/argv since it has irrelevant parameters. I think you don't need to worry about passing argc/argv unless you're loading system plugins. Are you loading system plugins from this stand-alone program?
